link:labelLink.link:label: Base items

Defines the basic conceptual meaning of a data point. Identifies the framework in which a data point is included. For FINREP, it indicates in which group of element of the financial statement should be included the data point (e.g. assets, liabilities, equity, income, expenses). For COREP, it indicates whether the data point should be computed in the numerator (own funds) or the denominator (exposures) of the Pillar I solvency ratio. It may determine whether the data point has a "debit" or a "credit" attribute.
Main category

Specifies the nature of the item reported (i.e. answers the question: what is reported?). For financial instruments, defines the instrument (e.g. deposits, debt securities issued...) or range of instruments reported. It should be defined for each data point.
Approach
Approach used for the calculation of capital requirements (or exposure value in LR)
Boolean total
Dimensions having only two values (usually denoted true and false)
Collateral/Guarantees
Defines the terms and conditions of the collateral and guarantees
Computability in own funds
Specifies the way in which the item computes in own funds
Callability of the instruments
For instruments on which a call option has been incorporated, it indicates whether they meet the conditions to qualify for inclusion in own funds.
Credit protection
Concepts related with the application of Credit Risk Mitigation techniques.
Credit quality
Defines the credit quality of the exposures according to the Credit Quality Steps scale
Counterparty
Party other than the reporting institution in a contract or transaction.
Currency
Currency
Exposure classes
Defines the exposure class for capital requirement purposes
External ratings
Concepts related with external credit ratings.
Event type
Defines the type of event that has generated an operational loss.
Geographical area
Geographical area
Impairment
Concepts related with monitoring credit quality of financial assets and off-balance sheet items (e.g. past due, impaired, defaulted)
Type of market
Defines the type of market on which reported instruments are traded. It includes the fair value hierarchy.
NACE code
NACE classification of economic activities
Percentages
Percentages
Positions in the instrument
Defines the position (long/short) taken in the instrument, as well as the aggregation level related to the market risk capital requirement calculations (gross/net).
Portfolio
Defined the portfolios reported. It comprises both accounting portfolios (e.g. Available-for-sale) and prudential portfolios (e.g. trading book).
Reference period
Defines a relative time point (reference date or period) to which the data refers.
Purpose
Purpose of the contract or transaction.
Related parties/Relationships
Defines the relationship between the reporting institution with an entity or a person; in particular, it specifies the type of related party.
Role in the securitisation process
Defines the role played by the reporting entity in the securitisation process.
Type of risk
Indicates the type of risk arising from exposures or transactions (e.g. credit risk or market risk).
Risk transfer treatment
Type of risk transfer (synthetic or transitional securitisations) and accounting treatment of the transaction
Securitisation structure
Tranche of the exposure in the securitisation structure
Type of activity
Defines the type of activity reported (e.g. asset management or custody)
Time interval
Time bands (e.g. > 60 days <= 90 days).
Underlying exposures in securitisations
Underlying exposures in securitisations
Correlation Trading Portfolio
CTP or non-CTP
Liquidity
Defines different liquidity-related conditions of assets and liabilities
Contingent scenario
Defines the contingent scenarios whose impact is reported
Scope of consolidation
Different scopes of consolidation of reporting when different from CRR scope
Accounting standard
The accounting standard used to prepare figures or reports
Code Lists
Codes for use in various metrics
Currency conversion approach
Indicates how monetary values should be reported i.e. if they should be converted to a single reporting currency, or reported as-is in the underlying currency
Interval of amounts
Indicates sizes of amounts intervals
Entity
An association, corporation, partnership, proprietorship, trust, or individual
Own funds and elegible liabilities
Own funds and elegible liabilities
ESG classification
ESG
Contracts/Transactions_SOS_Duplicate_637
Information related with Contracts. The difference to CR Category is that this is enumerated
